Visuals for "Integer", "Number", "Money" type attributes
Attributes of "Integer", "Number" and "Money" types are used to display numbers. Visuals for these attribute types are made for a clear representation of data as shown here below.
The display format of attribute values of "Integer", "Number" and "Money" types in the System is determined according to the selected
country
and
locale
.
For example, when the country is set to the USA and the locale is EN, the default number format will be as follows in accordance with international standards for the USA:
1,234,567.89
If the country "Austria" is selected, with the locale set to EN, the number will be displayed in the following format:
1.234.567,89
Visuals for integer attributes
Setting up the "Attribute by type (for numbers)" visual
The "Attribute by type (for numbers)" visual allows
selecting an attribute type in a configurable profile
.
This visual does not require additional settings.
After selecting a visual and saving the type, the System will display two fields in the profile for selecting:
object type;
attribute of the selected object type.

Setting up the "Input field with range slider" visual
This visual allows displaying the attribute as a slider in the profile. The visual is used ''
for working with the "Integer" attribute type
''. The attribute retains the value specified by user via the slider.
The visual settings contain the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Visual for attribute of the type "Integer"
Displaying the name of the selected attribute visual.
Maximum value
Selecting/inputting an algorithm that determines the maximum slider value. It can be defined by an integer value or an attribute, for example:
Minimum value
Selecting/inputting an algorithm that determines the minimum slider value. It can be defined by an integer value or an attribute, for example:
Maximum value (Virt.)
Selecting/inputting an algorithm that determines the virtual maximum slider value. This value limits the maximum slider value in the profile (optional).
Minimum value (Virt.)
Selecting/inputting an algorithm that determines the virtual minimum slider value. This value limits the minimum slider value in the profile (optional).
Step
Selecting/inputting an algorithm that determines the slider step. It can be defined by an integer value or an attribute.
Additional line
Entering text to display inside the slider (optional).
Centered
A flag that allows to center-align the text of the additional line (optional).
Allow a negative values
A flag that determines the use of negative values (optional).
Update the value when dragging
A flag that determines the immediate update of the attribute value and recalculation of related expressions during slider manipulation (optional). If the flag is not selected, the attribute value and recalculation of related expressions are updated after the slider value is set (after the user releases the slider).
Setting up the "Weekday" visual
The "Weekday" visual for the integer attribute
allows displaying a dropdown list for selecting a weekday.
This visual does not require additional settings.
Setting up the "ETL structure selection" visual
This visual allows to visually display the data structure used in the
ETL process
. The visual is usually used to display attributes of technical types, such as
ETL converters
.
The "Collection of input/output data" attributes
are displayed using the current visual.
To configure the visual:
select the visual;
specify the attribute containing the ETL structure.

Please note that the number of decimals is also specified on the "Basic" tab, which is a priority attribute property.
When displaying the value of the configured attribute, the System will indicate the percentage sign "%".
Setting up the "Scale-sensitive display" visual
The "Scale-sensitive display" visual allows displaying the "Arbitrary Precision Number (money)" attribute type in the required scale. The scale is set by the "Value scale"
[SPR_SCALE]
system type.
Instances of this type define the data display scale.
This object needs to be included in the configurable type with the object attribute. To display monetary attributes of this type, the "Number Display Considering Scale from Attribute Type" visual is used, selecting the required system attribute "Value scale"
[SPR_SCALE]
.
